Preliminary quantitative experiments have so far involved the non-contact acquisition of 10 individuals. The recognition of a single person on this limited data base is always successful, with no false rejection. A statistical analysis using a larger data base will provide the False Acceptance Rate (FAR) and the False Rejection Rate. Our current measurements show a FAR smaller than 1%.
